docs.lead_paragraph: Aaron Carroll has a very good takedown of an op-ed article by Senator Ron Johnson, who basically exploits his infant daughter's medical experience to make an incoherent attack on the Affordable Care Act. His daughter received excellent treatment, and he asserts that she wouldn't have received that kind of treatment under universal health insurance, because .... well, he doesn't explain.
docs.abstract: You mean, Europe has modern medicine too?
docs.snippet: You mean, Europe has modern medicine too?

docs.lead_paragraph: Want a peek into a possible future? Take a look at the exchange Wednesday morning on Twitter between Eric Fehrnstrom, the chief spokesman for Mitt Romney, the former governor of Massachusetts, and David Axelrod, one of President Obama's closest advisers.

headline.main: Axelrod and Romney Aide in Twitter Exchange

docs.abstract: Eric Fehrnstrom, spokesman for Mitt Romney, and David Axelrod, one of President Obama's closest advisers, spar over health care.
docs.snippet: Eric Fehrnstrom, spokesman for Mitt Romney, and David Axelrod, one of President Obama's closest advisers, spar over health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: One year after President Obama signed the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act into law, the public remains confused about the legislation, divided on its passage and unconvinced that it will improve health care.

headline.main: Polls Highlight Split on Health Care Law

docs.abstract: Two recent polls emphasize the partisan divide on the federal health care law, as it turns a year old.
docs.snippet: Two recent polls emphasize the partisan divide on the federal health care law, as it turns a year old.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: 8:58 a.m. | Updated A year after President Obama signed his health care law into effect, the two leading Republicans in Congress are making it clear that they do not intend to let up in their assault on the historic measure.

headline.main: Boehner, McConnell Push Assault on Health Care Law

docs.abstract: The House Speaker, John Boehner, and Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the Republican leader, promise to continue pursuing "full repeal" of President Obama's health-care law.
docs.snippet: The House Speaker, John Boehner, and Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, the Republican leader, promise to continue pursuing "full repeal" of President Obama's health-care law.
